Detailed Description

DUAL-POB Function.

The dual-pob board have 22 input/output pin free for use.

This pin are on PORTF, PORTB, PORTG and PORTE of the dual-pob cpu:

  • the PORTF pin 0 to 7, as digital input, digital output or analog input
  • the PORTB pin2, pin3 and pin7 as digital input/output
  • the PORTG pin0 to 4 as digital input/output
  • the PORTE pin 2 to 7 as digital input/output

Note:
Please note that only the PORTF can be use as analog input!
Example code: configure dual-pob input/output pins
  UInt8 portb=0;
  UInt8 porte=0;

  // Set pin7 of PORTB as output (the other pin are set as input by default)
  portb = IO_AS_OUTPUT << PIN_7 ;

  // Set pin2 and pin7 of PORTE as output (the other pin are set as input by default)
  porte = (IO_AS_OUTPUT << PIN_2) | (IO_AS_OUTPUT << PIN_7 ); 

  // Finally, write the i/o configuration:
  SetDualIOWay(portb, porte,IO_AS_DEFAULT,IO_AS_DEFAULT);

Example code: set/clear an output pin on the dual-pob:
  // Set pin7 of PORTE to 1 during 1 second

  SetDualOutput(OUTPUT_PORTE,PIN_7);

  Wait(1000);

  ClearDualOutput(OUTPUT_PORTE,PIN_7);

Example code: Get value of dual-pob input pin
  UInt8 value;

  // Get the pin value of PORTB
  value = GetDualInput(INPUT_PORTB,INPUT_1);

Author:
Pierre SEGUIN & Baptiste BURLES. POB-Technology

enum _dual_output_pin

Output pin number enumerations.

Use this enumeration in SetDualOutput() and ClearDualOutput() functions.

Enumerator:

PIN_1  pin1 of a I/O port
PIN_2  pin2 of a I/O port

Output port enumeration.

Enumerator:

OUTPUT_PORTE  select PORTE as output port
OUTPUT_PORTF  select PORTF as output port
OUTPUT_PORTG  select PORTG as output port

DC_MOTOR_LEFT  left
DC_MOTOR_RIGHT  right

Port input enumeration.

Use this enumeration with the GetDualInput() function.

Enumerator:
INPUT_PORTB  PORTB
INPUT_PORTE  PORTE
INPUT_PORTF  PORTF
INPUT_PORTG  PORTF
INPUT_NONE  NONE

enum _io_settings

IO pin settings enumeration.

Enumerator:
IO_AS_INPUT  Set io pin as input
IO_AS_OUTPUT  Set io pin as output
IO_AS_ANALOG  Set io pin as analog input
IO_AS_DEFAULT  Default io settings: input

Function Documentation

void ClearDualOutput ( OUTPUT_PORT  port,
OUTPUT_PIN  pin 
)

Clear output pin. Write a logical zero to output pin of the specified port. 

  // Clear pin7 of PORTE 

  ClearDualOutput(OUTPUT_PORTE,PIN_7);

Parameters:
port port's name.
pin pin's port to clear (PIN_0 to PIN_7)

UInt8 GetDualInput ( INPUT_PORT  port,
INPUT_PIN  pin 
)

Get input pin value. 

  UInt8 value;

  // Get value of pin 1 of PORTB

  value = GetDualInput(INPUT_PORTB,INPUT_1);

Parameters:
port port where read the value
pin pin number of port
Returns:
the pin value: 0 or 1. if selected port is wrong, the function will return 0xFF.

void SetDCMotor ( MotorMovement  move  ) 

Active dual-pob DC motors. 

  // Set speed:

  SetDCSpeed(0);

  // Run motor for 1 seconds:

  SetDCMotor( DC_MOTOR_RUN );

  Wait(10000);

  SetDCMotor(DC_MOTOR_STOP);

Parameters:
move DC motor activation

void SetDCSpeed ( UInt8  speed  ) 

Set speed of dual-pob DC motors.

This function calls SetPwm() to set the speed. If you want control the speed with more parameters, use the SetPwm().

Parameters:
speed DC motors speed (between 0 and 35)

void SetDualIOWay ( UInt8  portb,
UInt8  porte,
UInt8  portf,
UInt8  portg 
)

porte PORTE configuration word
portf PORTF configuration word
portg PORTG configuration word

void SetDualOutput ( OUTPUT_PORT  port,
OUTPUT_PIN  pin 
)

Set output pin Write a logical one to the output pin of the specified port. 

  // Set pin7 of PORTE to 1 

  SetDualOutput(OUTPUT_PORTE,PIN_7);

Parameters:
port port's name
pin pin's port to set (PIN_0 to PIN_7)

void SetPwm ( UInt8  period,
UInt16  dutycycle,
PwmPrescaler  prescaler 
)

Set pwm parameters of dual-pob DC motors.

You can compute the period and dutycycle parameters for this function with this formula:

period = ( PWM Period x CPU Frequency ) / prescaler - 1

dutyclycle = ( PWM Dutycycle x 4 x CPU Frequency ) / prescaler

With CPU Frequency = 20 MHz and PWM Period and PWM Dutycycle in seconds.

Parameters:
period PWM period configuration (see previous formula to compute this byte)
dutycycle Duty cycle configuration (see previous formula to compute this byte)
prescaler PWM prescaler value: 1, 4 or 16
